title: Importance in decision-making process when purchasing CE in the U.S. 2013
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 14 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups 18-49, and 50+. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
In Response Price, 50+ had the highest Share of respondents 95.0 among the 2 groups and in Friends have it, 50+ had the lowest Share of respondents 21.0.
Among all the Responses, 50+ had the highest Share of respondents 95.0 in Response Price and lowest value 21.0 in Response Friends have it.
Response Price and Friends have it had the biggest gap of 74.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 50+.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 14 different Responses for 2 groups 18-49, and 50+ that are presented on the X-axis.
In Response Price, 50+ had the highest Share of respondents 95.0 among the 2 groups and in Friends have it, 50+ had the lowest Share of respondents 21.0.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 14 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups 18-49, and 50+. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
In Response Price, 50+ had the highest Share of respondents 95.0 among the 2 groups and in Friends have it, 50+ had the lowest Share of respondents 21.0.
Among all the Responses, 50+ had the highest Share of respondents 95.0 in Response Price and lowest value 21.0 in Response Friends have it.
Response Price and Friends have it had the biggest gap of 74.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 50+.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 14 different Responses for 2 groups 18-49, and 50+ that are presented on the X-axis.
In Response Price, 50+ had the highest Share of respondents 95.0 among the 2 groups and in Friends have it, 50+ had the lowest Share of respondents 21.0.
In Response Price, 50+ had the maximum Share of respondents and it saw the lowest in Response Friends have it out of all 14 Responses.
The maximum Share of respondents for 50+ that was found in Response Price was 4.52 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Response Friends have it.
Out of all 2 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents was found in case of 18-49.
Averaging all 2 groups 18-49, and 50+, the Response Price is the maximum Share of respondents and Friends have it is the minimum Share of respondents.
